SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements emphasize system performance and reliability, focusing on minimizing downtime and ensuring smooth operation.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-004-NFR-001 specifically targets health monitoring and communication features, while P-001-NFR-002 focuses on general system responsiveness and lightweight design.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: High Performance and Reliability
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall ensure high reliability and performance, minimizing downtime and ensuring smooth operation, particularly for health monitoring and communication features, while maintaining lightweight and responsive design.

Conflicts.Note: P-007-NFR-001 emphasizes user control over data and compliance with privacy regulations, while P-003-NFR-001 requires traceability of all user actions and system responses without auto-deletion of logs. This creates a conflict between user privacy and the need for comprehensive traceability for compliance audits.

P-006-FR-004 requires offline functionality for areas with limited internet connectivity, while P-004-NFR-001 emphasizes high reliability and minimal downtime for continuous patient care. This creates a conflict between the need for offline access and the requirement for continuous, reliable online functionality.
